title: How to Make a Zen Garden for Your Desk

steps.headline: Obtain the items needed.
steps.description: These are: a shoebox lid, sand or soil, water, a small container to hold the water (a small tea light candle holder is a good choice), pebbles or small rocks, a bridge, fake or real moss, a comb or mini rake, and any additional items you'd like to add, just remembering that simplicity is important for a Zen garden.

steps.headline: Take the shoebox lid and the sand.
steps.description: If you're going to keep this Zen garden for a while, lay out clear wrap under the sand.

steps.headline: Pour the sand into the shoebox lid and level it out so that it is even across the shoebox lid.
Place the rock in the sand, wherever you'd like it to sit.
steps.description: A traditional Zen garden would have the rocks placed in the corners.

steps.headline: Add the moss and anything else that you have to put in your Zen garden.
Use the mini rake or comb to make patterns in the sand.
Put the water container on the sand and add the water.
steps.description: If you would like, put the bridge over the water.

steps.headline: Display the Zen garden on your desk.
steps.description: Use it to ponder life's mysteries and to keep yourself calm.
